precondition: The Windows 98 desktop is visible.
action: Click the 'My Computer' icon on the desktop.
expected_results: The 'My Computer' window will open, displaying the contents of your computer system.

precondition: The "My Computer" window is open. The "Cdrom (D:)" icon is visible within the window.
expected_results: The "Cdrom (D:)" window will open, displaying the contents of the CD-ROM drive. A new button labeled "Cdrom (D:)" will appear in the taskbar.

precondition: The "Cdrom (D:)" window is open and the file named "cc32d479.exe" is visible.
action: Click once on the "cc32d479.exe" file icon.
expected_results: The Netscape Communicator 4.79 setup window will open, displaying a welcome message and "Next >" and "Cancel" buttons.

precondition: The "Netscape Communicator 4.79 Setup" window is open, displaying a welcome message and the "Next >" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The window will display the "Software License Agreement" screen with the Netscape Client Products End-User License Agreement. The buttons at the bottom of the window will change to "< Back", "Yes", and "No".

precondition: A dialog box titled 'Software License Agreement' is open, displaying the Netscape Client Products End-User License Agreement.
expected_results: The 'Software License Agreement' dialog box will close, and the 'Setup Type' window for Netscape Communicator 4.79 will appear. This window allows you to choose between 'Typical' and 'Custom' installations.

precondition: The "Setup Type" window is open, with the "Destination Directory" field displaying the desired installation path.
expected_results: A dialog box titled "Question" will appear, asking if you want to create the selected installation directory.

precondition: A dialog box titled 'Question' is open, stating that the directory 'C:\Program Files\Netscape\Communicator' does not exist.
expected_results: The 'Question' dialog box will close, and the 'Netscape Desktop Preference Options' dialog box will open.

precondition: The "Netscape Desktop Preference Options" window is open, displaying options for default browser, home page, and web search settings.
action: Click the "Next >" button at the bottom of the window.
expected_results: The "Netscape Desktop Preference Options" window will be replaced by the "Select Program Folder" window, which allows you to choose the installation directory.

precondition: The "Select Program Folder" window is open, displaying the desired installation path in the "Program Folder:" text box.
expected_results: The "Select Program Folder" window will close, and the "Start Copying Files" window will appear.

precondition: The "Start Copying Files" window is open with the "Install >" button visible.
expected_results: A dialog box titled "Question" will appear with "Yes" and "No" buttons. The "Yes" button will be highlighted.

precondition: A dialog box titled "Question" is displayed with the message "Would you like to view the README file now?". The dialog box has two buttons: "Yes" and "No".
expected_results: The "Question" dialog box will be replaced with an "Information" dialog box. The new dialog box will display the message "Setup is complete. You may run Netscape Communicator 4.79 by double-clicking on one of the icons in the folder."

precondition: An "Information" dialog box with a blue background is open in the Netscape Communicator application. The dialog box indicates the completion of the Netscape Communicator 4.79 setup process.
expected_results: The "Information" dialog box will close.

precondition: The Netscape Communicator 4.79 application window is open and displaying a blank white page.
action: Click and drag the title bar of the Netscape Communicator window to the desired location on the screen.
expected_results: The Netscape Communicator window will move to the new position.

precondition: An open window titled "Netscape Communicator" is present on the screen.
action: Click the close button (✕) located in the top right corner of the "Netscape Communicator" window title bar.
expected_results: The "Netscape Communicator" window will close and be minimized to the taskbar, appearing as "Netscape Co..."

precondition: A Windows Explorer window titled 'Cdrom (D:)' is open and in focus.
action: Click the 'X' button in the top right corner of the 'Cdrom (D:)' window.
expected_results: The 'Cdrom (D:)' window will close.

precondition: The Windows 98 desktop is visible with icons for 'My Computer,' 'My Documents,' 'Internet Explorer,' 'Recycle Bin,' 'Netscape Communicator,' 'AOL Instant Messenger,' and 'RealPlayer Basic.'
action: Left Click on the desktop background.
expected_results: No immediate visual changes are expected.

precondition: The "Netscape Communicator" shortcut icon is visible on the Windows 98 desktop.
expected_results: A dialog box titled "Creating a New Profile" will appear. The dialog box explains that Netscape Communicator stores user settings and suggests creating a profile. It includes "< Back", "Next >", "Finish", and "Cancel" buttons.

precondition: The "Creating a New Profile" dialog box is open, and the "Next >" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The dialog box will change to the "Enter Your Name and Email Address" screen. The "Full Name" and "Email Address" fields will display example text.

precondition: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box is open with the "Next >" button visually emphasized.
expected_results: No visual changes will occur in the UI.

precondition: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box is open.
action: Type the letter "o" into the "Full Name" field.
expected_results: The letter "o" will appear in the "Full Name" field.

precondition: A dialog box titled "Enter your Name and Email Address" is open. The dialog box contains "< Back", "Next >", "Finish", and "Cancel" buttons.
expected_results: The dialog box should display the previous step in the installation process.

precondition: The dialog box titled 'Enter your Name and Email Address' is displayed.
expected_results: No visible changes will occur in the GUI.

precondition: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box is open.
expected_results: The letter 'A' will appear in the active text field.

precondition: A dialog box titled "Enter your Name and Email Address" is displayed.
action: Type the letters "li" into the "Full Name:" text field.
expected_results: The letters "li" will appear in the "Full Name:" text field.

precondition: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box is open. The cursor is blinking in the "Email Address:" field.
expected_results: The letters "ce" will appear in the "Email Address:" field.

precondition: A dialog box titled "Enter your Name and Email Address" is displayed, with text fields for 'Full Name:' and 'Email Address:'.
action: Type the letter 's' into the "Full Name:" field.
expected_results: The letter 's' will appear in the "Full Name:" field.

precondition: The dialog box titled "Enter your Name and Email Address" is displayed. The text field labeled "Full Name:" should be active.
action: Type the letters "on" using your keyboard.
expected_results: The letters "on" will appear in the "Full Name:" field.

precondition: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box is open.
expected_results: The "Enter your Name and Email Address" dialog box will be replaced with the "Choose a Name and Directory for your Profile" dialog box.

precondition: The "Choose a Name and Directory for your Profile" dialog box is open with the "Next >" button enabled.
expected_results: The "Choose a Name and Directory for your Profile" dialog box will be replaced with the "Set up your Outgoing Mail Server" dialog box. This new dialog box will contain a text field pre-filled with the word "mail", and the buttons "< Back", "Next >", "Finish", and "Cancel".

precondition: The "Set up your Outgoing Mail Server" dialog box is open with the "Outgoing mail (SMTP) server:" field present.
action: Click the "Finish" button at the bottom of the dialog box.
expected_results: The "Set up your Outgoing Mail Server" dialog box will be replaced with a "Netscape" dialog box displaying an error message: "Netscape is unable to locate the server home.netscape.com. Please check the server name and try again." An "OK" button will be available.

precondition: A pop-up window titled "Netscape" displays an error message stating "Netscape is unable to locate the server home.netscape.com. Please check the server name and try again." An "OK" button is present at the bottom of the window.
expected_results: The "Netscape" pop-up window will disappear. The bottom of the main window will display the error message "Unable to locate host home.netscape.com."
